CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In these two cases , AFM height images showed similar surface morphology with fairly small phase separation , and the root-mean-square ( rms ) values for the blend films from DCB and from TCB are 0.242 and 0.306 nm , respectively. These AFM results are consistent with their photovoltaic device performances ( vide supra ). The reason for that may be due to both DCB and TCB are good solvents for PSFDTBT. It is well - known that balanced electron and hole mobility of the active layer is required for high performance polymer solar cells. 2f The formation of an interpenetrating bicontinuous network between polymer donor and PCBM with an ideal domain size of 10-20 nm is crucial for charge generation and transportation. 18 For bulk heterojunction polymer solar cells , appreciate phase separation is a practical way to form bicontinuous donor - acceptor network. 19 We believe that the solar cell performance of this type of copolymer can be further improved by the optimization of film morphology and device fabrication conditions . An alternating copolymer PSFDTBT of spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole unit was designed and synthesized. PSFDTBT shows a broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility. Without using any additive and any post-treatment , polymer solar cells based on PSFDTBT / PC71BM demonstrated a PCE of 4.6% with a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based polymers applied in BHJ PSCs. High open - circuit voltage , simple device fabrication process , and easy synthesis make PSFDTBT a highly promising donor polymers for high efficiency polymer solar cells. We believe that spirobifluorene as a promising building block for conjugated polymer donor materials warrants further exploration and the performance of PSFDTBT - based polymer solar cells can be further improved from the optimization of device fabrication conditions .

Let's think step by step.

1. AFM height images: This is a type of image obtained using Atomic Force Microscopy (AFM). It does not refer to a specific material.
2. DCB and TCB: These are abbreviations for two unspecified materials. They are good solvents for PSFDTBT.
3. PSFDTBT: This is a specific copolymer of spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole units.
4. PCBM: This stands for [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester, which is a fullerene derivative often used as an acceptor material in organic solar cells.
5. Polymer donor: This refers to the material that provides electrons in a bulk heterojunction polymer solar cell. In this context, it is PSFDTBT.
6. PC71BM: This is a specific fullerene derivative used as an acceptor material in organic solar cells.
7. BHJ PSCs: This stands for Bulk Heterojunction Polymer Solar Cells.
8. Spirobifluorene: This is a specific organic compound used as a building block for conjugated polymer donor materials.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. DCB and TCB: These are two unspecified materials.
2. PSFDTBT: This is a copolymer of spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole units.
3. PCBM: This is [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester, a fullerene derivative.
4. Polymer donor: This refers to PSFDTBT.
5. PC71BM: This is a specific fullerene derivative.
6. Spirobifluorene: This is a specific organic compound.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| DCB |
| TCB |
| PSFDTBT (a copolymer of spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole units) |
| PCBM ([6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester) |
| Polymer donor (PSFDTBT) |
| PC71BM (a specific fullerene derivative) |
| Spirobifluorene (a specific organic compound) |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In these two cases , AFM height images showed similar surface morphology with fairly small phase separation , and the root-mean-square ( rms ) values for the blend films from DCB and from TCB are 0.242 and 0.306 nm , respectively. These AFM results are consistent with their photovoltaic device performances ( vide supra ). The reason for that may be due to both DCB and TCB are good solvents for PSFDTBT. It is well - known that balanced electron and hole mobility of the active layer is required for high performance polymer solar cells. 2f The formation of an interpenetrating bicontinuous network between polymer donor and PCBM with an ideal domain size of 10-20 nm is crucial for charge generation and transportation. 18 For bulk heterojunction polymer solar cells , appreciate phase separation is a practical way to form bicontinuous donor - acceptor network. 19 We believe that the solar cell performance of this type of copolymer can be further improved by the optimization of film morphology and device fabrication conditions . An alternating copolymer PSFDTBT of spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole unit was designed and synthesized. PSFDTBT shows a broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility. Without using any additive and any post-treatment , polymer solar cells based on PSFDTBT / PC71BM demonstrated a PCE of 4.6% with a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based polymers applied in BHJ PSCs. High open - circuit voltage , simple device fabrication process , and easy synthesis make PSFDTBT a highly promising donor polymers for high efficiency polymer solar cells. We believe that spirobifluorene as a promising building block for conjugated polymer donor materials warrants further exploration and the performance of PSFDTBT - based polymer solar cells can be further improved from the optimization of device fabrication conditions .

Let's think step by step.

1. AFM height images: This refers to the topographical images obtained using Atomic Force Microscopy (AFM).
2. rms values: Root-mean-square values.
3. blend films: The films made by blending two materials, DCB and TCB, in this context.
4. DCB and TCB: Two materials used in the study.
5. PSFDTBT: A copolymer of spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole unit.
6. PCBM: Fullerene derivative, [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester, used as an acceptor material.
7. PCE: Power conversion efficiency.
8. open-circuit voltage: The voltage at which no current flows between the electrodes of a photovoltaic cell under illumination.
9. HOMO and LUMO: Highest occupied molecular orbital and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital, respectively.
10. additive and post-treatment: Substances added during the fabrication process to improve the performance of the solar cells.
11. copolymer: A polymer made from two or more different monomers.
12. spirobifluorene: A heterocyclic organic compound used as a building block for conjugated polymer donor materials.
13. BHJ PSCs: Bulk heterojunction polymer solar cells.
14. device fabrication conditions: The conditions under which the solar cells are manufactured.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. AFM height images: Topographical information from Atomic Force Microscopy.
2. rms values: Root-mean-square values.
3. DCB and TCB: Materials with unspecified properties.
4. PSFDTBT: A copolymer with unspecified properties.
5. PCBM: Fullerene derivative with unspecified properties.
6. PCE: Power conversion efficiency.
7. open-circuit voltage: Voltage.
8. HOMO and LUMO: Molecular orbital energies.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| AFM height images |
| rms values |
| Power conversion efficiency (PCE) |
| Open-circuit voltage |
| Molecular orbital energies (HOMO and LUMO) |
| Materials (DCB, TCB, and PSFDTBT) |
| Fullerene derivative (PCBM) |

Paragraph: In these two cases , AFM height images showed similar surface morphology with fairly small phase separation , and the root-mean-square ( rms ) values for the blend films from DCB and from TCB are 0.242 and 0.306 nm , respectively. These AFM results are consistent with their photovoltaic device performances ( vide supra ). The reason for that may be due to both DCB and TCB are good solvents for PSFDTBT. Without using any additive and any post-treatment , polymer solar cells based on PSFDTBT / PC71BM demonstrated a PCE of 4.6% with a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based polymers applied in BHJ PSCs. High open - circuit voltage , simple device fabrication process , and easy synthesis make PSFDTBT a highly promising donor polymers for high efficiency polymer solar cells. We believe that spirobifluorene as a promising building block for conjugated polymer donor materials warrants further exploration and the performance of PSFDTBT - based polymer solar cells can be further improved from the optimization of device fabrication conditions .

Let's think step by step.

1. rms values for blend films from DCB and TCB:
- DCB: 0.242 nm
- TCB: 0.306 nm

2. ideal domain size for bicontinuous network: 10-20 nm
3. open-circuit voltage of PSFDTBT/PC71BM polymer solar cells: 0.94 V
4. hole mobility of PSFDTBT: not explicitly stated in the paragraph, but mentioned as "comparable"
5. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) and LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) positions of PSFDTBT: not explicitly stated in the paragraph, but mentioned as "broad absorption, appropriate HOMO/LUMO positions"

These are the material properties mentioned in the paragraph with their respective units.

1. rms values:
- DCB: 0.242 nm
- TCB: 0.306 nm

2. ideal domain size: 10-20 nm
3. open-circuit voltage: 0.94 V
4. hole mobility (implied, but not explicitly stated): not provided
5. HOMO and LUMO positions (implied, but not explicitly stated): not provided

| HOMO and LUMO positions (implied): not provided |

This table presents the material properties mentioned in the paragraph with their respective units in a Markdown table format. The properties "hole mobility" and "HOMO and LUMO positions" are included in the table but marked as "not provided" since they are not explicitly stated with their values in the paragraph.
